newsitem.title: USA: Syncronys sees Q1 operating loss.
newsitem.headline: Syncronys sees Q1 operating loss.

text.p: Syncronys Softcorp said Monday it expects an operating loss of between $1.2 million and $1.8 million on relatively minimal revenues for the first fiscal quarter of 1997, ending today.
The company said in a statement that revenues are beginning to increase and that the operating loss has been caused by a variety of expenses associated with extensive product development.
Syncronys said it began shipping its first of several new software products to be introduced by Christmas and begins shipping a second product today.

For the 1996 fiscal year ended June 30, Syncronys posted a net loss of $10.7 million, or $0.77 a share, on revenues before product recall returns of $12.7 million compared with net income of $692,000, or $0.05 a share, on revenues of $3.5 million in the previous fiscal year.

Fiscal 1996 was hurt by nonrecurring charges totalling $12.3 million for the costs associated with the recall of SoftRAM95. The nonrecurring charge also includes the associated costs of litigation -- all of which has now been preliminarily or fully settled.
